title: Luke Chapter 4 Quiz - Multi-Level
description: An enhanced quiz on Luke chapter 4 with Easy, Medium, Hard, and Theological levels. Each level has 15 carefully crafted questions. Choose your difficulty and dive in!

easy.title: Luke Chapter 4 Quiz - Easy Level
easy.description: Perfect for beginners! Test your basic knowledge of Luke Chapter 4.

questions.question: How long was Jesus tempted by the devil in the wilderness?
questions.correctAnswer: Forty days
questions.explanation: Jesus was tempted by the devil for forty days as stated in Luke 4:2.

questions.question: What did Jesus say man shall not live by alone?
questions.correctAnswer: Bread
questions.explanation: Jesus said, 'man shall not live by bread alone, but by every word of God' in Luke 4:4.

questions.question: Where did the devil take Jesus to show him all the kingdoms of the world?
questions.correctAnswer: A high mountain
questions.explanation: The devil took Jesus to a high mountain to show him all the kingdoms of the world in a moment of time as in Luke 4:5.

questions.question: What did the devil promise to give Jesus if He worshiped him?
options: All the power and glory of the kingdoms
The keys to the kingdom of heaven
questions.correctAnswer: All the power and glory of the kingdoms
questions.explanation: The devil said he would give Jesus all the power and glory of the kingdoms if He worshiped him (Luke 4:6-7).

questions.question: What was Jesus' response when the devil asked Him to worship him?
questions.correctAnswer: Get thee behind me, Satan
questions.explanation: Jesus answered, 'Get thee behind me, Satan: for it is written, Thou shalt worship the Lord thy God, and him only shalt thou serve' in Luke 4:8.

questions.question: Where did the devil take Jesus to tempt Him to cast Himself down?
questions.correctAnswer: The pinnacle of the temple
questions.explanation: The devil brought Jesus to the pinnacle of the temple to tempt Him to cast Himself down, as recorded in Luke 4:9.

questions.question: What scripture did Jesus quote to refuse the devil's temptation to throw Himself down?
options: Thou shalt not tempt the Lord thy God
Thou shalt love thy neighbor as thyself
Judge not, lest ye be judged
questions.correctAnswer: Thou shalt not tempt the Lord thy God
questions.explanation: Jesus responded, 'It is said, Thou shalt not tempt the Lord thy God' in Luke 4:12.

questions.question: After the devil ended all the temptation, what did he do?
options: He departed from Him for a season
He asked Jesus to follow him
questions.correctAnswer: He departed from Him for a season
questions.explanation: Luke 4:13 states the devil departed from Jesus for a season after the temptations ended.

questions.question: Where did Jesus return to teach after the wilderness temptation?
questions.correctAnswer: Galilee
questions.explanation: Jesus returned in the power of the Spirit into Galilee as noted in Luke 4:14.

questions.question: What book was delivered to Jesus when He went into the synagogue at Nazareth?
questions.correctAnswer: Book of Esaias (Isaiah)
questions.explanation: Luke 4:17 states that the book of the prophet Esaias was delivered to Jesus in the synagogue.

questions.question: True or False: Jesus read a passage about being anointed to preach the gospel to the poor.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: In Luke 4:18, Jesus read that the Spirit of the Lord anointed Him to preach the gospel to the poor.

questions.question: True or False: The people in the synagogue immediately accepted Jesus as a prophet without question.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: The people wondered and questioned Jesus as Joseph's son and later were filled with wrath, rejecting Him (Luke 4:22, 28).

questions.question: True or False: Jesus healed Simon's wife's mother by rebuking the fever.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Jesus rebuked the fever, and it left her, as described in Luke 4:39.

questions.question: Complete this verse from Luke 4:21: 'This day is this scripture _______ in your ears.'
questions.correctAnswer: fulfilled
questions.explanation: Jesus said, 'This day is this scripture fulfilled in your ears,' in Luke 4:21.

questions.question: What did Jesus say He must preach to other cities also?
questions.correctAnswer: The kingdom of God
questions.explanation: Jesus said, 'I must preach the kingdom of God to other cities also' in Luke 4:43.

medium.title: Luke Chapter 4 Quiz - Medium Level
medium.description: Ready for more? Apply biblical truths from Luke Chapter 4 to real-life situations.

questions.question: A fellow believer is struggling with temptation and asks how to resist it. Based on Luke 4, what biblical truth would you share about overcoming temptation?
options: Rely on the Word of God and refuse to worship anything but God
Use physical strength to fight the devil
Ignore the devil and hope the temptation goes away
Make bargains with the devil for power
questions.correctAnswer: Rely on the Word of God and refuse to worship anything but God
questions.explanation: Jesus resisted the devil's temptations by quoting Scripture and declaring worship belongs only to God (Luke 4:4, Luke 4:8, Luke 4:12). This shows the importance of relying on God's Word to overcome trials.

questions.question: How does Luke 4 teach us about humility and contentment when Jesus says, 'Man shall not live by bread alone, but by every word of God'?
options: Spiritual nourishment is as important as physical needs
We should only focus on material food
Bread is the only thing that matters for life
Self-sufficiency is the key to life
questions.correctAnswer: Spiritual nourishment is as important as physical needs
questions.explanation: Jesus emphasizes that physical needs like bread are not enough for life; spiritual sustenance through God's Word is essential (Luke 4:4). This teaches contentment that transcends material things.

questions.question: A believer is feeling discouraged about being rejected by family for their faith. How does Jesus' experience in Nazareth encourage them?
options: No prophet is accepted in his own country
God will always make everyone accept you
You should leave your family immediately
questions.correctAnswer: No prophet is accepted in his own country
questions.explanation: Jesus tells the people of Nazareth that prophets are often rejected by their own (Luke 4:24), encouraging believers to persevere despite rejection.

questions.question: What biblical principle about evangelism can be drawn from Jesus’ statement, 'I must preach the kingdom of God to other cities also'?
options: The gospel should be shared beyond familiar places
Only preach to those who accept you immediately
Stay in one place and avoid new challenges
questions.correctAnswer: The gospel should be shared beyond familiar places
questions.explanation: Jesus emphasizes the necessity of spreading the gospel to many locations, teaching believers to actively share their faith widely (Luke 4:43).

questions.question: How does Jesus’ healing of Simon’s mother-in-law teach us about serving others in the church community?
options: Acts of healing and care lead to active service
questions.correctAnswer: Acts of healing and care lead to active service
questions.explanation: After Jesus healed her, Simon’s mother-in-law immediately began to serve (Luke 4:39), showing that receiving God’s blessing leads to serving others.

questions.question: What does Jesus’ refusal to allow demons to speak reveal about humility and trust in God’s timing?
options: He controlled the situation and trusted God's timing
He wanted to show off his power
He encouraged the demons to speak freely
questions.correctAnswer: He controlled the situation and trusted God's timing
questions.explanation: Jesus rebuked demons so they would not reveal His identity prematurely (Luke 4:41), demonstrating humble control and trust in God’s plan.

questions.question: A believer is struggling with hunger and lack of provision. What encouragement does Luke 4 offer regarding dependence on God?
options: Depend on God’s word, not just physical bread
Only rely on your own efforts
questions.correctAnswer: Depend on God’s word, not just physical bread
questions.explanation: Jesus fasted for 40 days and emphasized living by God’s word, showing dependence on God beyond material needs (Luke 4:2, Luke 4:4).

questions.question: True or False: According to Luke 4, Jesus was led by the Spirit into the wilderness specifically to be tempted by the devil.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Luke 4:1-2 states Jesus was led by the Spirit into the wilderness where he was tempted by the devil for forty days, showing spiritual discipline and testing.

questions.question: True or False: Jesus immediately accepted the devil’s offer to gain all the kingdoms of the world if he worshiped him.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Jesus refused the devil and rebuked him, affirming worship belongs only to God (Luke 4:7-8), teaching obedience and faithfulness.

questions.question: When Jesus read from the book of Isaiah, He said the scripture was fulfilled that day. What does this teach about the importance of recognizing God’s timing in our lives?
options: God’s work happens at the appointed time
questions.correctAnswer: God’s work happens at the appointed time
questions.explanation: Jesus declared the prophecy fulfilled 'this day' (Luke 4:21), showing God’s timing is perfect and must be trusted.

questions.question: How does Luke 4 illustrate the importance of spiritual authority when Jesus commands the unclean spirit to come out?
options: Jesus demonstrates authority over evil by commanding spirits
Spirits obey only humans who are loud
Authority is irrelevant in spiritual matters
questions.correctAnswer: Jesus demonstrates authority over evil by commanding spirits
questions.explanation: Jesus rebuked the unclean spirit and it obeyed (Luke 4:35-36), teaching believers about trusting Jesus’ power in spiritual battles.

questions.question: A person is questioning their purpose after rejection from their community. What lesson about perseverance does Luke 4 provide?
options: Even Jesus was rejected but continued His mission
questions.correctAnswer: Even Jesus was rejected but continued His mission
questions.explanation: Jesus was rejected in Nazareth (Luke 4:28-30) but continued preaching and healing, encouraging perseverance through trials.

questions.question: What does Jesus’ healing of many sick at sunset teach us about generosity and compassion in serving others?
options: We should serve others generously regardless of time
Only help when it is convenient
questions.correctAnswer: We should serve others generously regardless of time
questions.explanation: Jesus healed many at sunset (Luke 4:40), showing continuous generous compassion in ministry.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: Jesus said, 'Thou shalt worship the Lord thy God, and him only shalt thou ______.'
questions.correctAnswer: serve
questions.explanation: Jesus rebuked the devil with this command about exclusive worship and service to God (Luke 4:8), emphasizing obedience and faithfulness.

questions.question: How does Luke 4 teach about the role of spiritual discipline in preparing for ministry?
options: Jesus was filled with the Holy Ghost and fasted before ministry
questions.correctAnswer: Jesus was filled with the Holy Ghost and fasted before ministry
questions.explanation: Jesus was full of the Spirit and fasted 40 days before beginning His public ministry (Luke 4:1-2, 4:14), showing spiritual preparation is essential.

hard.title: Luke Chapter 4 Quiz - Hard Level
hard.description: Challenge yourself with deep analysis and cross-biblical connections from Luke Chapter 4.

questions.question: In Luke 4, Jesus is led by the Spirit into the wilderness after being full of the Holy Ghost. What is the significance of the wilderness experience in biblical typology?
options: It symbolizes a place of testing and preparation, similar to Israel's 40 years in the wilderness
It represents a place of divine punishment for sin
It is primarily a symbol of isolation and abandonment without divine presence
It foreshadows the destruction of Jerusalem
questions.correctAnswer: It symbolizes a place of testing and preparation, similar to Israel's 40 years in the wilderness
questions.explanation: Luke 4:1-2 shows Jesus fasting and being tempted for 40 days, paralleling Israel's 40 years in the wilderness, indicating a time of testing and preparation.

questions.question: Which Old Testament scripture does Jesus quote when he responds to the devil's temptation to turn stones into bread?
questions.correctAnswer: Deuteronomy 8:3
questions.explanation: Jesus quotes 'Man shall not live by bread alone, but by every word of God,' which is from Deuteronomy 8:3, emphasizing reliance on God's word over physical sustenance (Luke 4:4).

questions.question: The devil offers Jesus all the kingdoms of the world in exchange for what condition?
questions.correctAnswer: Worshiping him
questions.explanation: In Luke 4:7, the devil says if Jesus worships him, all the kingdoms will be his, highlighting a temptation of idolatry and power.

questions.question: What is the significance of Jesus’ command to the devil, 'Get thee behind me, Satan,' in a Jewish context?
options: It echoes God's rebuke to Peter in Mark 8:33, signifying rejection of temptation
It was a common phrase used by priests
It was a phrase used to bless someone
It was a political statement against Roman authorities
questions.correctAnswer: It echoes God's rebuke to Peter in Mark 8:33, signifying rejection of temptation
questions.explanation: Jesus' phrase recalls the rebuke in Mark 8:33, indicating a refusal to accept satanic temptation and a call for Satan to take his place behind the servant, not leading him (Luke 4:8).

questions.question: When the devil brings Jesus to the pinnacle of the temple, he quotes scripture about angels keeping Jesus safe. From which Psalm does this quotation originate?
questions.correctAnswer: Psalm 91
questions.explanation: The devil quotes Psalm 91:11-12 about angels bearing up the faithful, but Jesus counters by citing 'Thou shalt not tempt the Lord thy God' (Luke 4:10-12).

questions.question: How does Jesus’ rejection of Satan’s temptations demonstrate fulfillment of the role of the 'Second Adam'?
options: By succeeding where Adam failed, resisting temptation and remaining obedient
By creating new laws for Israel
questions.correctAnswer: By succeeding where Adam failed, resisting temptation and remaining obedient
questions.explanation: Jesus’ victory over temptation echoes Adam’s failure in Eden, fulfilling the typology of the 'Second Adam' who obeys God perfectly (Luke 4:1-13).

questions.question: In Luke 4, Jesus reads from the scroll of the prophet Isaiah. Which mission statement does He proclaim?
options: To preach the gospel to the poor, heal the brokenhearted, and set the captives free
To establish a new law code
To build the temple in Jerusalem
questions.correctAnswer: To preach the gospel to the poor, heal the brokenhearted, and set the captives free
questions.explanation: Luke 4:18-19 quotes Isaiah 61:1-2, where Jesus declares His mission to bring good news to the poor and freedom to the oppressed.

questions.question: What is the reaction of the people in Jesus' hometown of Nazareth after He reads and proclaims the fulfillment of Isaiah's prophecy?
options: They are amazed but skeptical, questioning 'Is not this Joseph's son?'
They immediately worship Him as king
They report Him to the Roman authorities
questions.correctAnswer: They are amazed but skeptical, questioning 'Is not this Joseph's son?'
questions.explanation: Luke 4:22 records that the people marveled at His words but doubted because He was known as Joseph's son, reflecting resistance to prophetic fulfillment in one's own community.

questions.question: Jesus mentions two Old Testament prophets, Elijah and Elisha, in His discourse at Nazareth. What is the purpose of these references?
options: To illustrate that prophets are often rejected at home and minister to outsiders
To predict the exile to Babylon
questions.correctAnswer: To illustrate that prophets are often rejected at home and minister to outsiders
questions.explanation: In Luke 4:24-27, Jesus uses Elijah and Elisha to show how God's blessings were given to Gentiles rather than Israelites, emphasizing the rejection He faces.

questions.question: What literary device is prominently used in Jesus' temptation narrative in Luke 4, particularly in the sequence of the three temptations?
options: Chiasm, highlighting the central temptation about worship
questions.correctAnswer: Chiasm, highlighting the central temptation about worship
questions.explanation: The three temptations form a chiasm with the first and third dealing with proving identity and the central one focusing on worship, emphasizing Jesus' loyalty to God (Luke 4:3-8).

questions.question: How does the healing of Simon's mother-in-law in Luke 4 demonstrate Jesus’ authority over illness?
options: By rebuking the fever and immediately restoring her to service
By calling the disciples to pray
By sending her to the temple for healing
questions.correctAnswer: By rebuking the fever and immediately restoring her to service
questions.explanation: Luke 4:39 shows Jesus’ direct command over sickness, and the immediate healing signifies His divine authority and compassion.

questions.question: What is the significance of Jesus silencing demons who confess Him as the Christ in Luke 4?
options: He prevents premature public disclosure of His Messianic identity
He does not believe their confession
He wants to keep His miracles secret
questions.correctAnswer: He prevents premature public disclosure of His Messianic identity
questions.explanation: Luke 4:41 indicates Jesus silences demons because their testimony could cause misunderstanding about the timing and nature of His mission.

questions.question: True or False: After the temptations, Jesus immediately begins His public ministry in Galilee, teaching and healing with power.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Luke 4:14-15 and Luke 4:31-32 describe Jesus returning in the power of the Spirit and teaching with authority in Galilean synagogues.

questions.question: What cultural and historical significance does Jesus’ reading from Isaiah in the synagogue hold for His Jewish audience?
options: It announces the arrival of the Messiah fulfilling long-awaited prophecy
It is a political rebellion against Rome
It calls for immediate military uprising
It establishes a new religious calendar
questions.correctAnswer: It announces the arrival of the Messiah fulfilling long-awaited prophecy
questions.explanation: By reading Isaiah 61 in Luke 4:16-21, Jesus proclaims the fulfillment of the Messianic prophecy, a pivotal moment for His Jewish listeners anticipating deliverance.

questions.question: Why do the people in the synagogue in Nazareth become angry and attempt to kill Jesus after His speech?
options: Because He implied God’s blessing was extended to Gentiles and outsiders
Because He insulted the Roman authorities
Because He refused to read from the Torah
Because He claimed to be a king
questions.correctAnswer: Because He implied God’s blessing was extended to Gentiles and outsiders
questions.explanation: Jesus’ references to Elijah and Elisha ministering to non-Israelites (Luke 4:24-27) angered His audience, who rejected this inclusive message (Luke 4:28-29).

theological.title: Luke Chapter 4 Quiz - Theological Level
theological.description: Deep biblical theology from Luke Chapter 4 that unites all believers. Explore foundational truths about God, creation, and humanity.

questions.question: What theological significance does Jesus' being 'full of the Holy Ghost' at the start of His ministry signify?
options: Empowerment by the Spirit for ministry
A title for Jesus as God
questions.correctAnswer: Empowerment by the Spirit for ministry
questions.explanation: Luke 4:1 shows Jesus filled with the Holy Ghost, indicating His empowerment by the Spirit for His redemptive ministry, consistent with Isaiah 61:1, Acts 10:38, John 3:34, and Romans 8:11, which affirm Spirit-empowerment for divine mission.

questions.question: How long was Jesus tempted by the devil in the wilderness, and what does this reveal about the nature of His temptation?
options: Forty days, revealing His full identification with human testing
One day, indicating a brief test
questions.correctAnswer: Forty days, revealing His full identification with human testing
questions.explanation: Luke 4:2 states Jesus was tempted for forty days, paralleling Israel's wilderness testing (Deut 8:2), showing His full human experience of temptation without sin (Hebrews 4:15), affirming His role as the true Israel and perfect Savior.

questions.question: In Jesus' response to the devil's first temptation, which Old Testament principle does He invoke?
options: "Man shall not live by bread alone, but by every word of God."
"You shall worship the Lord your God and Him only shall you serve."
"You shall not tempt the Lord your God."
"The Lord is my shepherd; I shall not want."
questions.correctAnswer: "Man shall not live by bread alone, but by every word of God."
questions.explanation: Jesus quotes Deuteronomy 8:3 in Luke 4:4, emphasizing dependence on God's word over physical sustenance, teaching the primacy of spiritual nourishment consistent with Matthew 4:4 and Psalm 119:105.

questions.question: What theological claim is made by the devil when he offers Jesus 'all the kingdoms of the world'?
options: That he has delegated authority over earthly kingdoms
That Jesus must conquer kingdoms by force
That kingdoms are irrelevant to God's plan
That Jesus should reject any earthly power
questions.correctAnswer: That he has delegated authority over earthly kingdoms
questions.explanation: Luke 4:6 reveals the devil claiming delegated authority over worldly kingdoms, reflecting the reality of spiritual evil's temporary dominion (John 12:31, 2 Corinthians 4:4, Ephesians 2:2), which Christ challenges by affirming God's sole authority (Psalm 24:1).

questions.question: Which scriptural truth does Jesus affirm when He says, 'Thou shalt worship the Lord thy God, and him only shalt thou serve'?
options: Exclusive worship and service belong to God alone
Worship can be shared with angels
questions.correctAnswer: Exclusive worship and service belong to God alone
questions.explanation: In Luke 4:8, Jesus cites Deuteronomy 6:13, affirming monotheistic worship and service exclusive to God, a core biblical doctrine upheld throughout Scripture (Exodus 20:3-5, Isaiah 42:8, Matthew 22:37).

questions.question: What is the significance of Jesus' refusal to cast Himself down from the temple pinnacle using Scripture?
options: It forbids tempting God and misusing divine protection
It permits testing God to demonstrate faith
It encourages miraculous displays to prove deity
It shows indifference to personal safety
questions.correctAnswer: It forbids tempting God and misusing divine protection
questions.explanation: Luke 4:12 cites Deuteronomy 6:16 to show Jesus rejects tempting God, emphasizing trust without presumption, consistent with teachings in Matthew 4:7 and Psalm 91:11-12 about trusting God without testing Him.

questions.question: After the temptations, how does the Spirit empower Jesus' ministry according to this chapter?
options: Jesus returns in the power of the Spirit and gains fame
Jesus relies solely on His own strength
Jesus immediately performs miracles without teaching
questions.correctAnswer: Jesus returns in the power of the Spirit and gains fame
questions.explanation: Luke 4:14 describes Jesus returning in Spirit-power, initiating His public ministry marked by teaching and miracles, aligning with Isaiah 61:1-3 and Acts 10:38 regarding Spirit-anointed mission.

questions.question: What messianic prophecy does Jesus read and claim to fulfill in His hometown synagogue?
options: Isaiah 61:1-2 about preaching good news, healing, and liberation
Psalm 23 about the Lord as shepherd
questions.correctAnswer: Isaiah 61:1-2 about preaching good news, healing, and liberation
questions.explanation: Jesus reads Isaiah 61:1-2 in Luke 4:17-21, announcing His messianic mission to preach, heal, and liberate, fulfilling Old Testament prophecy and revealing His role as the anointed Savior (cf. Luke 7:22, Acts 10:38).

questions.question: How do the people of Nazareth initially respond to Jesus' declaration that the scripture is fulfilled in their hearing?
options: They marvel and question, 'Is not this Joseph's son?'
They immediately believe and worship Him
They ignore Him and leave quietly
questions.correctAnswer: They marvel and question, 'Is not this Joseph's son?'
questions.explanation: Luke 4:22 records amazement mixed with skepticism about Jesus' identity, reflecting human difficulty accepting Jesus' messiahship in familiar contexts, consistent with John 1:11 and Mark 6:3 about rejection in His hometown.

questions.question: What Old Testament examples does Jesus cite to illustrate that prophets are not accepted in their own country?
options: Elijah sent to a widow in Sidon and Elisha cleansing Naaman the Syrian
Moses leading Israel out of Egypt and David as king
Abraham going to Canaan and Joseph ruling Egypt
Isaiah's prophecies in Jerusalem and Jeremiah's lament
questions.correctAnswer: Elijah sent to a widow in Sidon and Elisha cleansing Naaman the Syrian
questions.explanation: In Luke 4:25-27, Jesus references Elijah and Elisha ministering outside Israel to show God's grace extends to Gentiles, and prophets face rejection at home, consistent with 1 Kings 17 and 2 Kings 5.

questions.question: What was the reaction of the synagogue congregation to Jesus' words about prophets being rejected in their own country?
options: They were filled with wrath and tried to kill Him
They praised Him and invited Him to stay
questions.correctAnswer: They were filled with wrath and tried to kill Him
questions.explanation: Luke 4:28-29 shows the congregation's anger leading to an attempt to throw Jesus off a cliff, illustrating human rejection of divine truth, paralleling the rejection of prophets in 1 Kings 19 and Jeremiah 26.

questions.question: How does Jesus demonstrate His authority in the synagogue at Capernaum?
options: By commanding an unclean spirit to come out of a man
By performing only verbal teachings without miracles
By avoiding confrontation with evil spirits
questions.correctAnswer: By commanding an unclean spirit to come out of a man
questions.explanation: Luke 4:33-35 shows Jesus exercising authority over demons, demonstrating His divine power over evil, consistent with His role as Messiah in Mark 1:25-27 and Luke 11:20.

questions.question: What is the significance of the people’s amazement at Jesus' teaching and miracles?
options: His word was with authority and power unlike the scribes
They only cared about the miracles, not the teaching
They considered Him a mere teacher
questions.correctAnswer: His word was with authority and power unlike the scribes
questions.explanation: Luke 4:36 and 4:32 highlight the authoritative nature of Jesus' teaching and miracles, signifying His unique divine authority, fulfilling Deuteronomy 18:15-19 and Isaiah 55:11.

questions.question: How does Jesus' healing of Simon's mother-in-law reflect His messianic ministry?
options: It demonstrates His power over sickness and His compassion
It was a purely symbolic act without real healing
It was performed only to gain popularity
It showed His reliance on others' prayers
questions.correctAnswer: It demonstrates His power over sickness and His compassion
questions.explanation: Luke 4:38-39 depicts Jesus healing the fever, showing His authority over illness and His care for individuals, consistent with Isaiah 53:4 and Matthew 8:16-17 portraying the Messiah as healer.

questions.question: Why does Jesus silence the demons who confess Him as the Christ?
options: Because they knew His identity but He did not want premature revelation
Because He wanted to hide His identity permanently
Because He welcomed public declarations from demons
questions.correctAnswer: Because they knew His identity but He did not want premature revelation
questions.explanation: Luke 4:41 explains Jesus rebuked demons to prevent premature disclosure of His messianic identity, aligning with the Messianic Secret motif in Mark 1:34 and Isaiah 42:1.
